clusters.title: Former NRL star Josh McGuire charged with strangling child
clusters.neutral_headline: Former NRL Player Josh McGuire Charged with Child Strangulation

items.title: Former NRL star Josh McGuire charged with strangling child
items.standfirst: A complaint against the Broncos, Dragons, Maroons and Kangaroos enforcer was made to investigators following two alleged incidents that unfolded last week.
items.content: Former rugby league star Josh McGuire has been charged with serious offences relating to a child.The NRL enforcer who played almost 200 games for the Brisbane Broncos before joining the Cowboys and then the Dragons in 2021 was brought to the Brisbane Watchhouse by police and charged on Tuesday with two charges, including one of common assault.A complaint against McGuire was made to investigators following two alleged incidents that unfolded last week.READ MORE: Man dies after being pulled from ocean pool It's understood these charges relate to the alleged strangulation of a five-year-old child. McGuire made 14 appearances for the Queensland Maroons. He was part of the 2017 Kangaroos World Cup-winning side before a brief stint in the Super League. He's previously been an ambassador for Ronald McDonald House Charities and Mates4Mates, and returned to the Broncos in a coaching role last year. He finished up in that role earlier this year, and has been working in marketing. He's expected to face Brisbane Magistrates Court on December 17.DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

clusters.title: Owner of German Shepherd Arnie faces string of extra charges
clusters.neutral_headline: German Shepherd Owner Faces Additional Charges
bullet_summary: The owner of a beloved German Shepherd found dead in a ute has been charged with more offences after police investigated an allegedly false report regarding his dog and car
Nathan McKeown reported his dog had been stolen

items.title: Owner of German Shepherd Arnie faces string of extra charges
items.standfirst: The owner of a beloved German Shepherd found dead in a ute has been charged with more offences after police investigated an allegedly false report regarding his dog and car.
items.content: The owner of a beloved German Shepherd found dead in a ute has been charged with more offences after police investigated an allegedly false report regarding his dog and car.

items.title: Owner of German shepherd Arnie faces more charges after case takes bizarre turn
items.standfirst: Nathan McKeown reported his dog had been stolen. He was the only one charged.
items.content: T he owner of a beloved German shepherd found dead in a ute has been charged with a string of additional offences after police investigated an allegedly false report regarding his dog and car.Nathan McKeown, 43, fronted several public appeals for information after it was reported his dog Arnie and Toyota Hilux had been stolen from an address in Queensland while the German shepherd was asleep in the tray on November 7.The ute was found 10 days later on November 17 by a member of the public with Arnie deceased inside.READ MORE: 1000 jobs slashed in $4 billion public service bloodbathIn a bizarre twist, police later alleged the ute had not been stolen and McKeown was charged with one count of breaching a duty of care of an animal.The charge was updated this week to one count of injuring animals (causing injury or death) by night. McKeown was also charged with three counts of driving a car without a driver's licence due to demerit points, one count of driving under the influence and serious obstruction of police.He is expected to appear before a Brisbane Court this month. Detectives from the Bayside Criminal Investigation branch will allege in court that McKeown drove his Hilux into Amelia Street in Brisbane's Fortitude Valley and left on foot around 10.30pm on November 7.Police will allege Arnie was left inside the vehicle at that time.READ MORE: How Australia's world-leading social media ban will be enforcedThe next morning, it is alleged McKeown told his partner that the vehicle had been stolen from a Wynnum address.She then reported the theft to police.Police will allege the man's partner was not aware that the Hilux had not been stolen.The search for Arnie became a highly publicised case, with police and community groups all joining the search for the suspected stolen car and dog. READ MORE: Disturbing unseen images of Epstein's private island lair revealedQueensland Police say the investigation is ongoing, and thanked the public for their assistance. "Media and the public are thanked for their extensive assistance throughout the investigation," a spokesperson said."Police are aware this has been a highly publicised case, and offences of this nature may cause distress and upset members of the public."DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

ai_summary: The owner of the deceased German Shepherd, Arnie, faces more charges.
Police investigated a potentially false report regarding the dog and car.
Nathan McKeown reported his dog stolen.
McKeown is the only person charged in the case.
The case has taken an unexpected turn during the investigation.

clusters.title: Baby bonus father Costello wants falling fertility 'back on the agenda'
clusters.neutral_headline: Former Treasurer Calls for Fertility Rate Discussions

items.title: Baby bonus father Costello wants falling fertility 'back on the agenda'
items.standfirst: With Australia's fertility rate at a new low and concerns about its economic impact on the future, the former treasurer behind the early 2000s baby boom says all options should be on the table to encourage more children.
items.content: With Australia's fertility rate at a new low and concerns about its economic impact on the future, the former treasurer behind the early 2000s baby boom says all options should be on the table to encourage more children.

ai_summary: Australia's fertility rate has reached a new low.
The former treasurer wants fertility to be discussed again.
He is concerned about the economic impact of low birth rates.
He suggests considering all options to encourage more children.
The early 2000s saw a baby boom during his time.

items.title: Locals called it 'Paedophile Island' but for Epstein it was 'perfect'
items.standfirst: Little St James is commonly referred to "Epstein Island" and according to attorneys for his accusers, the island was the site of many crimes committed against underage girls.
items.content: Little St James is commonly referred to "Epstein Island" and according to attorneys for his accusers, the island was the site of many crimes committed against underage girls.

The legal proceedings focus on the crimes committed on the island.

clusters.title: Leading groups for UK women and girls to close doors for trans women

items.title: Leading groups for UK women and girls to close doors for trans women

clusters.title: What's in pregnancy supplements? Sorting science from marketing spin
clusters.neutral_headline: Experts Discuss Pregnancy Supplement Regulations

items.title: What's in pregnancy supplements? Sorting science from marketing spin
items.standfirst: Health experts say tighter regulations around pregnancy supplements are needed as newer brands replace folic acid — a key nutrient shown to prevent birth defects — with a lesser-studied alternative.
items.content: Health experts say tighter regulations around pregnancy supplements are needed as newer brands replace folic acid — a key nutrient shown to prevent birth defects — with a lesser-studied alternative.

ai_summary: Health experts want tighter regulations on supplements.
Newer brands replace folic acid with alternatives.
Folic acid prevents birth defects, experts say.
The focus is on the safety of pregnancy supplements.
The need for better regulation is being highlighted.
